newsitem.title: USA: Tropical Storm Marco drifting south of Jamaica.
newsitem.headline: Tropical Storm Marco drifting south of Jamaica.

text.p: MIAMI, Nov 22 (Reuter ) - Tropical Storm Marco drifted in the Caribbean south of Jamaica on Friday as its outer rainbands reached the island of Hispaniola, the National Hurricane Center said.
At 1 p.m. EST (1800 GMT), the center of Marco was located at latitude 15.9 north, longitude 75.2 west, about 175 miles (280 km) southeast of Kingston, Jamaica.
The storm was drifting eastward but no significant motion was expected through Saturday, forecasters said.
Maximum sustained winds were estimated to be about 65 mph (100 kph) and satellite images indicated the storm may be weakening, forecasters said.
Heavy rain from the storm were occuring primarily over the Caribbean Sea but some of its outer rainbands were over Hispaniola, raising the threat of flash floods and mudslides in mountainous areas.
